section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Someone may bathe at the sixty-eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage,

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: and worship the twelve Shiva-lingam stones,

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

translation.text: but if he indulges in slander, then all of this is useless. ||1||

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: How can the slanderer of the Holy Saints be saved?

text: ਸਰਪਰ ਜਾਨਹੁ ਨਰਕ ਹੀ ਪਰੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Know for certain, that he shall go to hell. ||1||Pause||

translation.text: Why do you indulge in slander, O people of the world?

translation.text: Says Ravi Daas, he is a sinner; he shall go to hell. ||4||2||11||7||2||49|| Total||
